changelog.release_notes:
- Support Chalk Platform (Pebble Time Round)
- Always show filled (instead of hollow) compass arrows, even when the compass is not fully calibrated.

New features:
- Option to use imperial units instead of metric
- Monochrome version looks a bit nicer now
- Compass indicator for monochrome version, too

New features:
- Minor visual improvements
- Exit app via double-click on back button
Fixed a bug in the direction calculation.

New features:
- Color! (On Pebble Time)
- Show compass in color mode
- Don't show arrow when compass data is invalid
- Short press on back button only switches on the backlight - press back button for 3 seconds to exit

data.description:
Go to a place. Make a bookmark. Return without getting lost.

This is not a full-blown navigation software. It simply tells you the distance (as the crow flies) and direction to your destination. I made it for finding my tent while drunk at night at a heavy metal festival. Might also work for pop festivals or huge parking lots.

Instructions:
- Enable high accuracy GPS mode on your phone.
- Long-press any of the three buttons on the right to save your current location.
- Short-press a button to select a previously saved destination.
- When the compass arrows are only shown as outline or not shown at all, you need to calibrate the compass. Rotate your Pebble in all directions until the arrows become visible and filled. (This may take some patience.)
- When the big arrow turns into a second circle, you are pretty close to your destination. At this time, you should stop looking at your watch and instead look for any physical objects in your vicinity that might provide clues as to where you are, and maybe even why you thought it might be a good idea to come here. Trust yourself. You probably had a reason. Maybe even a good one.
- To exit the app, double-click the back button.

Feedback welcome!

Planned features:
- Better GPS error handling
